entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as one of the four men making their way up to the castle. He is described as a member of the old Committee.

entities.name: macnair
entities.description: Macnair is mentioned as one of the four men making their way up to the castle. He is described as being told by Fudge to murder Sirius on the spot.

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is mentioned as one of the four men making their way up to the castle. He is described as telling Macnair to murder Sirius on the spot.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is mentioned in the context of being murdered by Macnair, as suggested by Fudge.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as expressing regret that Dumbledore did not come with them when they went down into the passage.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as watching the four men climb the castle steps and as expressing bitter thoughts about Fudge and Macnair.

entities.name: lupin
entities.description: Lupin is mentioned as another figure sprinting down the stone steps and haring toward them.

relationships.description: Fudge is described as telling Macnair to murder Sirius on the spot, indicating that Fudge has ordered or instructed Macnair to do something.
Harry is described as watching Lupin sprinting down the stone steps and haring toward them, indicating that Harry has seen or observed Lupin.
